confession.seduction_context: On way to Wisembach at wood of la Gotte Mourel to collect debts; offered money which she accepted because heavily in debt; money turned out to be excrement

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrelled with her husband at Ogneviller at salt workings
chased his sow out of her field, throwing a hatchet at it; he objected she might have injured the animal
too busy to help in her garden when asked
husband of witness was frequenting her house; when she tried to dissuade him he threatened and beat her
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il luy viendroit des gros esclans, entendante des grosses affaires

testimony.quarrel_subject: did not invite Marie to customary banquet after having baby
found her stealing beans in her garden

witnesses.name: Valentine femme Demenge de la Rolbe

testimony.quarrel_subject: hired husband to cut hay, but was angry when rain came

witnesses.name: Thoussaince femme Demenge Claude Jean le Maire

testimony.quarrel_subject: came to house complaining that one of her children had killed one of her hens; called her children 'fils de genoxe'
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle en auroit bien sa raison, et luy en conviendroit bien

testimony.quarrel_subject: refused to go and work for her because too busy
his horse strayed in Marie's meadow, making her angry
gone to share out fruits with her husband; she tried to make division, he told her to leave it to those who knew how; also pushed her
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il verroit comme il luy en prendroit

timeline.subject: Marie Alexey
timeline.details: Released from château de Lusse by ducal order and taken to St Dié for trial

timeline.subject: Marie Alexey
timeline.details: Questioned; retracted confession made 2 weeks earlier at Lusse, saying it was obtained by torture

timeline.subject: Marie Alexey
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; accused several of theft and other crimes

timeline.subject: Marie Alexey
timeline.details: Rémy asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Marie Alexey
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; given thumbscrews and rack; confessed to witchcraft

timeline.subject: Marie Alexey
timeline.details: Rémy asks for death sentence by burning

timeline.subject: Marie Alexey
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death, to be strangled after feeling fire

accomplices_named.name: Jennon femme Colin de la Gotte
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; described as among youngest and merriest; had candle

accomplices_named.name: Didielle femme Demenge Colinel
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat on another occasion; spilt pot to prevent making hail

prior_accusations.context: Named Marie before execution; Marie went to Taintrux on execution day to confront her

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Mandray
notable_quotes.french: que s'il n'y avoit poinct de sorciere ilz y en amenoient une
notable_quotes.english: if there were no witches [at Colroy] they were bringing one
notable_quotes.context: Drunk at Marie's wedding feast, after bringing her to Colroy from Wisembach

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon femme Demenge Gros Demenge
notable_quotes.french: s'il n'estoit pas au diable avec elle
notable_quotes.english: wasn't he with the devil with her
notable_quotes.context: Response to Marie asking where her husband was

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie Alexey
notable_quotes.french: qu'il luy viendroit des gros esclans, entendante des grosses affaires
notable_quotes.english: that big troubles would come to her, meaning serious problems
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Jennon femme Demenge Gros Demenge after quarrel

notable_quotes.speaker: Thoussaince femme Demenge Claude Jean le Maire
notable_quotes.context: Called Marie's children this after her hen was killed

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie Alexey
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle en auroit bien sa raison, et luy en conviendroit bien
notable_quotes.english: that she would have satisfaction for this, and it would suit her well
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Thoussaince after hen dispute

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon des Eaues
notable_quotes.french: qu'il verroit comme il luy en prendroit
notable_quotes.english: that he would see how it would turn out for him
notable_quotes.context: Threat after quarrel over fruit division

notable_quotes.speaker: Marie Alexey
notable_quotes.french: par ruddesse, n'aiant faict le mal qu'elle a dit, mauldissant l'heure qu'elle at esté née, disant qu'elle a dit des bourdes sur elle
notable_quotes.english: by harshness, not having done the evil she said, cursing the hour she was born, saying she told lies about herself
notable_quotes.context: Explaining why she confessed at Lusse

relationships.evidence_text: daughter of late Alexy le Marchal of Wisembach
daughter of late Alexy le Marchal of Wisembach and his wife Marguitte
husband of witness was frequenting her house

relationships.person1: Valentine femme Demenge de la Rolbe
relationships.evidence_text: Valentine femme Demenge de la Rolbe

relationships.person1: Thoussaince femme Demenge Claude Jean le Maire
relationships.evidence_text: Thoussaince femme Demenge Claude Jean le Maire
brought by late Demenge Mandray of Wisembach to Colroy at marriage

economic_context.details: Marie was heavily in debt when seduced by devil (confession states she accepted money because they were heavily in debt). Multiple disputes over property damage (sow in field, horse in meadow, cart damage). Quarrel with Claude des Eaues over pears owed as debt settlement. Marie's husband had lost horses to value of 1000 francs. Marie offered to give one of her two cows to support witch-hunt expenses.

harms_catalog.harm_description: horse died after being ill overnight
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrelled with her husband at Ogneviller at salt workings

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for 10 months, unable to work or rest, with no appetite
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: chased his sow out of her field, threw hatchet at it; he called her witch
harms_catalog.method_alleged: passed in front of his house

harms_catalog.harm_description: goat died next day after drinking milk mixed with water
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: too busy to help in her garden when asked

harms_catalog.harm_description: bad foot afflicted with 'mal St Antoine'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: too busy to help in her garden when asked

harms_catalog.harm_description: eyes starting from head, lost use of limbs; ill for 15 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: husband was frequenting Marie's house; Jennon confronted Marie calling her 'faulce sorciere'
harms_catalog.method_alleged: passed by several times as she was washing in river, then when she went to fields

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: did not invite Marie to customary banquet after having baby
found her stealing beans in her garden

refused to sell her a goat

harms_catalog.harm_description: died day after drinking milk with water

harms_catalog.harm_description: hole appeared in stomach with intestines coming out
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: horse strayed in Marie's meadow making her angry
gone to share fruits; she tried to make division; he told her to leave it to those who knew how and pushed her

material_culture.context: sent in pot to Georgeatte in childbed; suspected of being poisoned

material_culture.object: bread, salt, ashes, 3 kinds of greens
material_culture.context: counter-magical healing remedy obtained from Marie's house/garden
Marie carried in corset to protect herself from devil
Colin le Bourguignon threw at sow in Marie's field
used at sabbat to cook meat
magical powder to languish/grey powder to kill
value of horses Jean Chastellain had lost

Marie found stealing from Catherine's garden
owed to Marie by Claude des Eaues as debt settlement
Marie accused Demenge Gros Demenge of stealing

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; Marie's residence for 14-15 years
Location of court where trial was held
Where Marie was initially imprisoned and tortured before being transferred to St Dié
Location of salt workings (salines) where quarrel occurred
Location of Marie's seduction by devil and sabbat gatherings; 2 km north of Wisembach
Where Beneitte femme Colin le Maire was executed; Marie went there on execution day
Where cunning woman lived who identified Marie as causing animal deaths
Location of court where Nicolas Stengel had been
Where Marie heard a trial read out
Where Jennon was washing when Marie passed by several times
Multiple references to fields where damage occurred and harms manifested
Behind house where calf remains found; also Marie's meadow damaged by horse

historical_context.military_details: Soldiers were lodged with Marie; all said she was witch; one soldier claimed to have become ill after she gave him soup
animal_predation: wolf ate foal (though Demenge Gros Demenge had previously suspected someone else)
economic_hardship_indicators: Marie heavily in debt when seduced by devil
Marie and husband had only 2 cows
Jean Chastellain lost horses to value of 1000 francs
religious_calendar_references: St Martin (arrest on eve of St Martin)
St Jean (last St Jean - around June 24)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Colin le Bourguignon called Marie witch; she said she would seek reparation if she had witness (Vincent le Crouvesier could hear) but did nothing
Multiple witnesses had called Marie witch without her seeking reparation
Claude des Eaues refused to give her pears in settlement of debt

legal_context.redress_outcome: Marie threatened to seek reparation for being called witch but never followed through, even when Vincent le Crouvesier was present as witness
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Imprisoned at château de Lusse by officials of Sieur de Barbay; spent 3 weeks in tower but became ill and was not sent back there; gave birth to child while imprisoned; transferred to St Dié by ducal order on April 15, 1598

change_de_nancy.modification_details: to be strangled after feeling fire (rather than burned alive)

hearsay_chains.content: identified Marie as responsible for animal deaths based on meadow damage
gypsies claimed to cure then threatened to give back illness when he called them thieves
all soldiers said she was witch
soldier became ill after Marie gave him soup

emotional_state_notes: cursing the hour she was born
damning herself if she confessed things she had not done
cried out so loudly under thumbscrews she could not be interrogated
begged to be released from rack
said she was cold during torture session

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Demenge Gros Demenge had stolen salt and Didielle wanted to kill her; had stolen sack of oats; wolf had eaten foal and he previously suspected someone else
Nicolas Stengel had been before court at Raon and had stolen field from Ranguinel children
Georgeatte femme Michiel Humbert had stolen onions
Barbon femme Hanns le Musnier was reputed to be 'une ribaulde' (disreputable woman)
had found Thoussaince femme Demenge Claude Jean le Maire stealing fruit
Claudon des Eaues had accused her of death of cows which were already dead before the quarrel

third_parties.name: Demenge Mandray
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: brought her to Colroy from Wisembach at marriage
third_parties.context: Got drunk at wedding feast and said if there were no witches at Colroy they were bringing one; this started Marie's reputation

third_parties.name: Beneitte femme Colin le Maire
third_parties.context: Executed at Taintrux for witchcraft; Marie went to Taintrux on execution day to confront her after hearing she was accused

third_parties.name: Vincent le Crouvesier
third_parties.context: Was in field and could hear when Colin le Bourguignon called Marie witch; Marie said she would seek reparation if she had witness but did nothing

third_parties.name: cunning woman at Tantviller
third_parties.context: Identified Marie as responsible for animal deaths based on meadow damage; initially refused to name her saying her master forbade it because she had told others who reproached the accused causing quarrels

third_parties.name: gypsies
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: consulted by Colin le Bourguignon for healing
third_parties.context: Colin sought healing from gypsies and gave them property; realized they were cheating and took property back calling them thieves; they said they would give back the illness

third_parties.name: midwife
third_parties.context: Told Marie that Catherine's miscarriage occurred because she was young and had not called midwife in time

third_parties.name: Colas le Broleux
third_parties.context: Michiel Humbert said in his presence that they had eaten soup made with Marie's milk and given rest to goat which did not die

third_parties.name: Sieur de Barbay
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: his officials held her at Lusse
third_parties.context: Marie was held by his officials at château de Lusse before ducal order secured her release

third_parties.name: M de Chasteaubrehain
third_parties.context: Claudon Betey was maire for him

third_parties.name: Hantzo Gaillard
third_parties.context: Aided servant of M de Barbay in arresting Marie on eve of St Martin

third_parties.name: Lienard Michiel
third_parties.context: Aided servant of M de Barbay in arresting Marie on eve of St Martin

third_parties.name: priest at Taintrux
third_parties.context: Present to confess Beneitte at execution; told Marie to go back home when she wanted to justify herself

third_parties.name: Marion femme Demenge Husson
third_parties.context: Named as accomplice seen at sabbat; also went to Taintrux before Marie on day of Beneitte's execution

third_parties.name: Jean Chastellain (children)
third_parties.context: Marie had 5 children by Jean, all living, including one born while imprisoned at Lusse; he had child by previous marriage

third_parties.name: hangman
third_parties.context: According to Demenge Ranguinel, told him he would burn Marie's feet and was preparing iron rods (broches de fer) for her

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed witness testimony, torture confession, and appellate review. Notable features include: extensive use of counter-magical healing (bread, salt, ashes, 3 kinds of greens); Marie's active defense including accusing witnesses of crimes; confession obtained under torture at Lusse, retracted, then renewed under torture at St Dié; Change de Nancy modified sentence to strangling after feeling fire rather than burning alive. Marie claimed confession at Lusse was coerced by threat of further torture from guard Demenge Ranguinel. Rich detail on economic hardship, debt, property disputes, and theft accusations.
